title.rendered: Were You Affected by Hurricane Florence?

content.rendered:
A Note For Customers Affected by Hurricane Florence

Over the weekend, Hurricane Florence hit the Eastern parts of North and South Carolina hard, with 90 MPH winds causing flooding, falling trees, loss of power, and other havoc. We hope you spent the weekend safe, wherever you are.

We understand that if your home, business, or loved ones have been affected by this storm, you’ve got a lot more than your repayment schedule to worry about right now.

If you’re a Fundbox customer affected by the storm, we encourage you to contact us at (800) 493-0419. Our customer support team is standing by to help.

For businesses located in major disaster areas, we’ll be offering extra support with your ACH repayments. You may receive an email from the Fundbox disaster relief team about this. Every situation is different, so if you need assistance or have any questions, please give us a call.

From the whole Fundbox team, we’re rooting for you and your family. If you’ve been affected by the storm, we’re here to help get you back on your feet.

How to help those affected by Florence

If you haven’t been personally affected by the storm, and you’d like to help those who have, here are a few important ways.

According to CNN: “GoFundMe has verified a campaign for Task Force 75, a team of veterans who have brought boats and supplies to Wilmington, North Carolina, to help with search and rescue operations for people and animals.”

In times like these, blood donations can also be crucial for saving lives. To locate a blood bank where you can donate, head to the AABB website.

Finally, if you’d like more detailed information about how to help, Charity Navigator has created a guide to some of the best organizations where you can donate to those affected by Florence.
